   Joshua Gillin
   By Joshua Gillin May 26, 2015

The saga of state spending enforcer Jeb Bush's one-time alias, Veto Corleone

   Former Gov.

Media reports said John Thrasher, then speaker of the House, dubbed Bush
   "Veto Corleone" after the fictional mafia don (spelled Vito Corleone) for
   his liberal use of the power.

Our ruling

   Bush said "they called me Veto Corleone" as governor for his frequent use
   of the line-item veto.
